ground_truth: He advances a step. Thorwald comes down the two steps, pauses at the bottom. Miss Lonely Hearts is standing in the yard outside her apartment, looking up to the porch of Miss Torso. Thorwald fights to dislodge Jeff's grip. Looking down on Jeff's face, showing his strain and the pain of Thorwald's attack. Doyle pulls himself to the top of the wall. From Doyle's viewpoint, Jeff is hanging out the window and Thorwald is hammering at his hands and arms with bare fists. Thorwald and Jeff are struggling. Doyle reaches the top of the wall and looks up at Jeff. Jeff, as seen from Doyle's angle, is hanging, somehow weathering Thorwald's insane attack. Jeff's grip begins to slip. Lisa is white-faced and frightened. He opens his eyes. Winces with pain. Doyle then looks up to the detective. Stella tugs at Doyle's arm and stands on tiptoe to whisper something into his ear. Doyle turns quizzically at Stella. Beginning on Jeff's window thermometer, the CAMERA PANS FROM RIGHT TO LEFT around the neighborhood. In the songwriter's apartment, we see the songwriter with a guest—Miss Lonely Hearts. The songwriter is placing the first recording of his new song on a record player for her to hear. Both in dress and manner she seems quite happy and adjusted to life. It is a full symphonic arrangement which is heard over. Thorwald's apartment is empty, stripped of its furnishings. Two painters are repainting the walls. The siffleuse and her husband are on their fire escape, training a new white dog to ride in their basket. Miss Torso is practicing her ballet again; she wears a white leotard. The sound of someone at the door interrupts her. She goes to the door, opens it an inch or two cautiously. When she sees who is outside, she throws open the door. An innocuous, unhandsome and somewhat shy army private enters with a barracks bag slung over one shoulder. She kisses him fondly after closing the door. He puts down the barracks bag, tosses his hat into a chair and, with the attitude of a man who belongs there, goes to the icebox to see what's to eat. The newlyweds are arguing. The CAMERA PANS past Jeff who is asleep in his wheelchair facing away from the window. CAMERA MOVES DOWN to the lower part of his body and we see that both his legs are now in casts. The CAMERA LIFTS SLIGHTLY to show Lisa sitting on the sofa nearby. She wears Levis and a plaid cotton shirt. She is reading a book on travel. She looks up briefly at Jeff. When she realizes he is asleep, she puts down the travel book and reaches for the latest copy of Harper's Bazaar.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: He progresses a pace. Thorwald descends the two steps, halts at the base. Miss Lonely Hearts is positioned in the courtyard outside her apartment, gazing up to the veranda of Miss Torso. Thorwald struggles to break Jeff's clasp. Gazing down on Jeff's visage, revealing his tension and the anguish of Thorwald's onslaught. Doyle hoists himself to the crest of the barrier. From Doyle's perspective, Jeff is dangling out the casement and Thorwald is pounding at his hands and arms with naked fists. Thorwald and Jeff are grappling. Doyle attains the summit of the barrier and glances up at Jeff. Jeff, as viewed from Doyle's standpoint, is dangling, somehow enduring Thorwald's deranged assault. Jeff's grasp commences to slide. Lisa is pale-faced and terrified. He opens his eyes. Grimaces with discomfort. Doyle then glances up to the detective. Stella pulls at Doyle's limb and stands on tiptoe to murmur something into his ear. Doyle turns inquisitively at Stella. Initiating on Jeff's window thermometer, the CAMERA PANS FROM RIGHT TO LEFT around the vicinity. In the songwriter's apartment, we observe the songwriter with a visitor—Miss Lonely Hearts. The songwriter is positioning the first recording of his new melody on a phonograph for her to listen. Both in attire and demeanor she seems quite content and adapted to existence. It is a full symphonic orchestration which is heard over. Thorwald's apartment is vacant, emptied of its furnishings. Two decorators are repainting the partitions. The siffleuse and her spouse are on their fire escape, training a new white canine to ride in their basket. Miss Torso is rehearsing her ballet again; she wears a white leotard. The sound of someone at the door interrupts her. She proceeds to the door, opens it an inch or two cautiously. When she perceives who is outside, she throws open the door. An innocuous, unhandsome and somewhat shy army private enters with a barracks bag slung over one shoulder. She kisses him tenderly after shutting the door. He places down the barracks bag, flings his hat into a chair and, with the demeanor of a man who belongs there, goes to the icebox to see what's to consume. The newlyweds are quarreling. The CAMERA PANS past Jeff who is dormant in his wheelchair facing away from the window. CAMERA MOVES DOWN to the lower part of his body and we observe that both his legs are now in casts. The CAMERA LIFTS SLIGHTLY to show Lisa seated on the sofa nearby. She wears Levis and a plaid cotton shirt. She is perusing a book on journey. She glances up briefly at Jeff. When she realizes he is dormant, she places down the journey book and reaches for the latest edition of Harper's Bazaar.

test_cases.description: He is advanced a step. The two steps are descended by Thorwald, and he pauses at the bottom. Miss Lonely Hearts stands in the yard outside her apartment, looking up to the porch of Miss Torso. Jeff's grip is fought to be dislodged by Thorwald. Jeff's face is looked down upon, showing his strain and the pain of Thorwald's attack. Doyle pulls himself to the top of the wall. From Doyle's viewpoint, Jeff hangs out the window, and Thorwald hammers at his hands and arms with bare fists. The struggle between Thorwald and Jeff continues. The top of the wall is reached by Doyle, who looks up at Jeff. From Doyle's angle, Jeff hangs, somehow weathering Thorwald's insane attack. Jeff's grip begins to slip. Lisa is white-faced and frightened. His eyes are opened. He winces with pain. Then, Doyle looks up to the detective. Stella tugs at Doyle's arm and stands on tiptoe to whisper something into his ear. Stella is turned to quizzically by Doyle. Beginning on Jeff's window thermometer, the neighborhood is panned around by the CAMERA FROM RIGHT TO LEFT. In the songwriter's apartment, the songwriter is seen with a guest—Miss Lonely Hearts. The first recording of his new song is placed on a record player by the songwriter for her to hear. In both dress and manner, she seems quite happy and adjusted to life. A full symphonic arrangement is heard over. Thorwald's apartment is empty, stripped of its furnishings. The walls are being repainted by two painters. On their fire escape, the siffleuse and her husband train a new white dog to ride in their basket. Ballet is practiced by Miss Torso again; she wears a white leotard. The sound of someone at the door interrupts her. The door is cautiously opened an inch or two by her. When she sees who is outside, the door is thrown open by her. An innocuous, unhandsome, and somewhat shy army private enters with a barracks bag slung over one shoulder. He is kissed fondly after the door is closed by her. The barracks bag is put down by him, his hat is tossed into a chair, and, with the attitude of a man who belongs there, the icebox is approached by him to see what's to eat. An argument is occurring between the newlyweds. Jeff, who is asleep in his wheelchair facing away from the window, is panned past by the CAMERA. The lower part of his body is moved down to by the CAMERA, and we see that both his legs are now in casts. Lisa is shown sitting on the sofa nearby as the CAMERA LIFTS SLIGHTLY. She wears Levis and a plaid cotton shirt. A book on travel is being read by her. She looks up briefly at Jeff. Realizing he is asleep, the travel book is put down by her, and she reaches for the latest copy of Harper's Bazaar.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Thorwald advances a step and pauses at the bottom of two steps. Miss Lonely Hearts stands outside her apartment, looking up at Miss Torso's porch. Thorwald struggles to break Jeff's grip, showing Jeff's strain and pain. Doyle climbs the wall, seeing Jeff hanging out the window as Thorwald attacks his hands and arms. Jeff's grip weakens, and Lisa looks frightened. Jeff opens his eyes, wincing in pain. Doyle looks up at Jeff, then turns to Stella, who whispers in his ear. The camera pans from Jeff's window thermometer across the neighborhood. In the songwriter's apartment, Miss Lonely Hearts listens to his new song, appearing happy and adjusted. Thorwald's apartment is empty, being repainted. The siffleuse and her husband train a new white dog on their fire escape. Miss Torso practices ballet in a white leotard, interrupted by a knock. She cautiously opens the door, then joyfully welcomes a shy army private. He enters, puts down his bag, and checks the icebox. The newlyweds argue. The camera pans past Jeff, asleep in his wheelchair with both legs in casts, to Lisa on the sofa in Levis and a plaid shirt. She reads a travel book, then switches to Harper's Bazaar when she sees Jeff is asleep.

test_cases.description: Thorwald steps down, pausing at the bottom. Miss Lonely Hearts stands outside, looking at Miss Torso's porch. Thorwald struggles against Jeff's grip. Doyle climbs the wall, seeing Jeff hanging as Thorwald attacks. Jeff's grip weakens. Lisa is frightened. Doyle looks at Jeff, then Stella whispers to him. The camera pans from Jeff's window across the neighborhood. In the songwriter's apartment, Miss Lonely Hearts listens to his new song, appearing happy. Thorwald's apartment is empty, being repainted. The siffleuse and her husband train a dog. Miss Torso practices ballet, interrupted by a shy army private. She kisses him, and he checks the icebox. The newlyweds argue. The camera pans to Jeff asleep in his wheelchair, legs in casts, and Lisa nearby in Levis, reading. She switches from a travel book to Harper's Bazaar when she sees Jeff asleep.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: He takes a deliberate step forward, advancing cautiously. Thorwald descends the two steps, pausing momentarily at the bottom. Miss Lonely Hearts is standing in the yard outside her apartment, gazing upward toward the porch of Miss Torso. Thorwald struggles to break free from Jeff's firm grip. Looking down, Jeff's face reveals the strain and pain caused by Thorwald's aggressive attack. Doyle pulls himself up to the top of the wall with effort. From Doyle's perspective, Jeff is precariously hanging out of the window while Thorwald relentlessly hammers at his hands and arms with his bare fists. The struggle between Thorwald and Jeff is intense. Doyle finally reaches the top of the wall and looks up at Jeff. From Doyle's angle, Jeff is seen hanging on, somehow enduring Thorwald's frenzied assault. Jeff's grip begins to weaken and slip. Lisa stands nearby, her face pale with fear and anxiety. He opens his eyes, wincing with pain. Doyle then shifts his gaze upward to the detective. Stella tugs gently at Doyle's arm and stands on tiptoe to whisper something into his ear. Doyle turns to Stella with a quizzical expression. Beginning at Jeff's window thermometer, the CAMERA PANS FROM RIGHT TO LEFT, sweeping around the neighborhood. In the songwriter's apartment, we observe the songwriter with a guest—Miss Lonely Hearts. The songwriter is placing the first recording of his new song on a record player for her to listen to. Both in her attire and demeanor, she appears quite happy and well-adjusted to life. It is a full symphonic arrangement that is heard playing. Thorwald's apartment is now empty, stripped of all its furnishings. Two painters are busy repainting the walls. The siffleuse and her husband are on their fire escape, training a new white dog to ride in their basket. Miss Torso is practicing her ballet once again; she is dressed in a white leotard. The sound of someone at the door interrupts her practice. She approaches the door cautiously, opening it just an inch or two. Upon seeing who is outside, she throws the door wide open. An innocuous, unhandsome, and somewhat shy army private enters, carrying a barracks bag slung over one shoulder. She kisses him fondly after closing the door behind him. He sets down the barracks bag, tosses his hat into a chair, and, with the demeanor of a man who feels at home, goes to the icebox to see what there is to eat. The newlyweds are engaged in an argument. The CAMERA PANS past Jeff, who is asleep in his wheelchair, facing away from the window. The CAMERA MOVES DOWN to the lower part of his body, revealing that both his legs are now encased in casts. The CAMERA LIFTS SLIGHTLY to show Lisa sitting on the sofa nearby. She is dressed in Levis and a plaid cotton shirt. She is engrossed in reading a book on travel. She glances up briefly at Jeff. Realizing he is asleep, she sets down the travel book and reaches for the latest copy of Harper's Bazaar.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: He takes a deliberate and measured step forward, advancing with a sense of caution and awareness. Thorwald makes his way down the two steps, pausing momentarily at the bottom to gather his bearings. Meanwhile, Miss Lonely Hearts is standing in the yard outside her apartment, her eyes gazing upward toward the porch where Miss Torso resides. In a struggle to break free, Thorwald finds himself ensnared in the firm grip of Jeff. Looking downward, Jeff's face vividly reveals the strain and pain inflicted by Thorwald's aggressive and persistent attack. Doyle, with effort and determination, pulls himself up to reach the top of the wall. From Doyle's perspective, Jeff is seen precariously hanging out of the window while Thorwald relentlessly hammers away at his hands and arms with his bare fists. The struggle between Thorwald and Jeff is nothing short of intense and dramatic. Doyle, at long last, reaches the top of the wall and looks upward toward Jeff. From Doyle's vantage point, Jeff is seen clinging on, somehow managing to endure Thorwald's frenzied and unyielding assault. As the struggle persists, Jeff's grip begins to weaken, and his hold starts to slip. Nearby, Lisa stands, her face a pale canvas of fear and anxiety. He opens his eyes, wincing in pain from the ordeal. Doyle then shifts his gaze upward, directing it toward the detective. Stella, standing beside him, tugs gently at Doyle's arm and stands on tiptoe to whisper something quietly into his ear. Doyle turns to Stella, his face reflecting a quizzical expression. Beginning at Jeff's window thermometer, the CAMERA PANS FROM RIGHT TO LEFT, sweeping around and capturing the essence of the neighborhood. Inside the songwriter's apartment, we observe the songwriter accompanied by a guest—Miss Lonely Hearts. The songwriter is in the process of placing the first recording of his newly composed song on a record player for her to listen to and enjoy. Both in her attire and demeanor, she appears to be quite happy and well-adjusted to the rhythms of life. A full symphonic arrangement is heard playing, enveloping the room in rich sound. Thorwald's apartment is now empty, completely stripped of all its furnishings. Two painters are busily engaged in repainting the walls, restoring them to a blank canvas. The siffleuse and her husband are on their fire escape, training a new, white dog to courageously ride in their basket. Miss Torso, dressed in a pristine white leotard, is once again practicing her ballet routine. The sound of someone at the door interrupts her practice, causing her to approach the door cautiously and open it just an inch or two. Upon seeing who is outside, she throws the door wide open with enthusiasm. An innocuous, somewhat shy, and unhandsome army private steps inside, carrying a barracks bag slung over one shoulder. She greets him with a fond kiss after closing the door behind him. The private sets down the barracks bag, tosses his hat casually into a chair, and, with the carefree demeanor of someone who feels right at home, goes to the icebox to investigate what there is to eat. Meanwhile, the newlyweds are engaged in an argument, voices rising and falling. The CAMERA PANS past Jeff, who is peacefully asleep in his wheelchair, which is facing away from the window. The CAMERA MOVES DOWN to reveal the lower part of his body, showing that both his legs are now encased in casts. The CAMERA LIFTS SLIGHTLY to capture Lisa sitting nearby on the sofa. She is dressed comfortably in Levis and a plaid cotton shirt. Engrossed in reading a book on travel, she momentarily glances up at Jeff. Realizing he is asleep, she sets down the travel book and reaches for the latest issue of Harper's Bazaar instead.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He takes a deliberate step forward, advancing cautiously. Meanwhile, Thorwald descends the two steps with measured movements, pausing momentarily at the bottom as if contemplating his next move. Outside, Miss Lonely Hearts stands in the yard, her gaze fixed upward toward the porch where Miss Torso is visible. In a tense struggle, Thorwald attempts to break free from Jeff's determined grip, his face contorted with effort and aggression. Jeff, feeling the strain and pain from Thorwald's relentless attack, looks down, his expression a mix of determination and discomfort. Doyle, with effort, pulls himself up to the top of the wall, his eyes scanning the scene before him. From Doyle's vantage point, he sees Jeff precariously hanging out of the window, while Thorwald relentlessly hammers at Jeff's hands and arms with his bare fists. The struggle between Thorwald and Jeff intensifies, each man fighting for control. Doyle finally reaches the top of the wall, his eyes locking onto Jeff, who, from Doyle's perspective, is somehow enduring Thorwald's frenzied assault. Jeff's grip begins to falter, his fingers slipping as he struggles to hold on. Lisa, observing the scene, turns pale with fear, her face a mask of anxiety. Jeff opens his eyes, wincing in pain as he assesses his precarious situation. Doyle then shifts his gaze upward, seeking guidance from the detective. Stella, standing beside Doyle, tugs at his arm, rising on tiptoe to whisper something urgently into his ear. Doyle turns to Stella, his expression quizzical, trying to comprehend her whispered message. The camera begins its journey, starting at Jeff's window thermometer, panning smoothly from right to left, capturing the vibrant life of the neighborhood. In the songwriter's apartment, the camera reveals the songwriter hosting a guest—Miss Lonely Hearts. He carefully places the first recording of his new song on a record player, eager for her to hear it. Miss Lonely Hearts, both in her attire and demeanor, appears content and well-adjusted to her surroundings. The room fills with the rich sound of a full symphonic arrangement, enveloping them in music. Meanwhile, Thorwald's apartment stands empty, stripped of its furnishings, as two painters diligently repaint the walls. On the fire escape, the siffleuse and her husband are busy training a new white dog to ride in their basket, their actions filled with gentle encouragement. Miss Torso, dressed in a white leotard, practices her ballet with graceful movements, her routine interrupted by the sound of someone at the door. She approaches the door cautiously, opening it just an inch or two to peek outside. Recognizing the visitor, she throws the door open wide, revealing an innocuous, unhandsome, and somewhat shy army private with a barracks bag slung over one shoulder. She greets him warmly, kissing him fondly before closing the door behind him. The private sets down his barracks bag, casually tosses his hat into a chair, and with the ease of someone who feels at home, heads to the icebox to see what food is available. Meanwhile, the newlyweds are engaged in an argument, their voices a backdrop to the unfolding scene. The camera pans past Jeff, who is asleep in his wheelchair, positioned away from the window. The camera moves downward, revealing that both of Jeff's legs are now encased in casts. It then lifts slightly to show Lisa sitting nearby on the sofa, dressed in Levis and a plaid cotton shirt, absorbed in a book on travel. She glances up briefly at Jeff, and upon realizing he is asleep, she sets aside the travel book and reaches for the latest copy of Harper's Bazaar, ready to immerse herself in its pages.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Thorwald descends the steps and pauses, while Miss Lonely Hearts stands outside, gazing at Miss Torso's porch. As Thorwald struggles to free himself from Jeff's grip, Doyle climbs the wall, witnessing Jeff precariously hanging out the window under Thorwald's assault. Jeff's grip weakens, causing Lisa to turn pale with fear. Despite the pain, Jeff opens his eyes. Stella whispers something to Doyle, who looks at her quizzically. The camera pans across the neighborhood, revealing the songwriter playing his new symphony for a content Miss Lonely Hearts. Thorwald's apartment is now empty, with painters at work. The siffleuse and her husband train a new dog on their fire escape. Miss Torso, in a white leotard, practices ballet until interrupted by a visitor. She joyfully welcomes a shy army private, who enters with a barracks bag, kisses her, and checks the icebox. Meanwhile, the newlyweds argue. The camera pans to Jeff, asleep in his wheelchair with both legs in casts, then shifts to Lisa, dressed casually, reading a travel book. Noticing Jeff asleep, she switches to Harper's Bazaar.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He advances a step, appearing tense and determined. Thorwald, a quiet man who is suspected of a gruesome crime in the neighborhood, comes down the two steps, pauses at the bottom with an ominous presence. Miss Lonely Hearts, a woman often yearning for connection, is standing in the yard outside her apartment, looking up to the porch of Miss Torso, a young dancer known for her vibrant social life, who frequently practices her routines outside. Thorwald fights to dislodge Jeff's grip, his actions driven by desperation to conceal his secrets. Looking down on Jeff's face, showing his strain and the pain of Thorwald's attack, the situation intensifies. Doyle, a detective and long-time friend of Jeff, pulls himself to the top of the wall. From Doyle's viewpoint high above the ground, Jeff is hanging out the window and Thorwald is hammering at his hands and arms with bare fists, driven by panic. Thorwald and Jeff are struggling fiercely as Doyle reaches the top of the wall and looks up at Jeff. Jeff, as seen from Doyle's angle, is hanging, somehow weathering Thorwald's insane attack despite the odds. Jeff's grip begins to slip, highlighting the peril of the moment. Lisa is white-faced and frightened, a testament to the gravity of the scene. He opens his eyes, trying to muster strength. Winces with pain, aware of the danger he is in. Doyle then looks up to the detective who has just arrived, urgently needing assistance. Stella, who works as a nurse and has seen the events through Jeff's window, tugs at Doyle's arm and stands on tiptoe to whisper something into his ear, likely sharing crucial information. Doyle turns quizzically at Stella, processing her urgent message. Beginning on Jeff's window thermometer, a detail indicating the transition of time with the changing seasons, the CAMERA PANS FROM RIGHT TO LEFT around the neighborhood. In the songwriter's apartment, known for its lively tunes often drifting through open windows, we see the songwriter with a guest—Miss Lonely Hearts. The songwriter is placing the first recording of his new song on a record player for her to hear, a gesture that brings her much joy and signifies new beginnings. Both in dress and manner she seems quite happy and adjusted to life, a stark contrast to her earlier solitude. It is a full symphonic arrangement which is heard over, filling the air with hope and possibility. Thorwald's apartment is empty, stripped of its furnishings, suggesting his hasty departure from the neighborhood. Two painters are repainting the walls, preparing it for new occupants. The siffleuse, a woman known for singing to herself, and her husband are on their fire escape, training a new white dog to ride in their basket, adding a touch of everyday life to the scene. Miss Torso is practicing her ballet again; she wears a white leotard, embodying grace and dedication, a routine familiar to her neighbors. The sound of someone at the door interrupts her. She goes to the door, opens it an inch or two cautiously, possibly due to recent events in the neighborhood. When she sees who is outside, she throws open the door with relief. An innocuous, unhandsome and somewhat shy army private enters with a barracks bag slung over one shoulder, signaling a reunion after time spent apart due to his military duties. She kisses him fondly after closing the door, showing her affection. He puts down the barracks bag, tosses his hat into a chair and, with the attitude of a man who belongs there, goes to the icebox to see what's to eat, reflecting his comfort and familiarity in her home. The newlyweds are arguing, a reminder of the ordinary ups and downs of marriage. The CAMERA PANS past Jeff who is asleep in his wheelchair, a result of an earlier accident involving a fall, facing away from the window. CAMERA MOVES DOWN to the lower part of his body and we see that both his legs are now in casts, immobilizing him and contributing to his dependency on observing the neighborhood through his lens. The CAMERA LIFTS SLIGHTLY to show Lisa sitting on the sofa nearby. She wears Levis and a plaid cotton shirt, a casual attire suggesting her comfort in Jeff's apartment. She is reading a book on travel, reflecting her adventurous spirit and desire to explore the world. She looks up briefly at Jeff, her concern for him evident. When she realizes he is asleep, she puts down the travel book and reaches for the latest copy of Harper's Bazaar, indulging in a moment of personal interest.

High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. Both in dress and manner she seems quite happy and adjusted to life. It is a full symphonic arrangement which is heard over. Thorwald's apartment is empty stripped of its furnishings. Two painters are repainting the walls. The siffleuse and her husband are on their fire escape training a new white dog to ride in their basket. Miss Torso is practicing her ballet again. she wears a white leotard. The sound of someone at the door interrupts her. She goes to the door opens it an inch or two cautiously. When she sees who is outside she throws open the door. An innocuous unhandsome and somewhat shy army private enters with a barracks bag slung over one shoulder. She kisses him fondly after closing the door. He puts down the barracks bag tosses his hat into a chair and with the attitude of a man who belongs there goes to the icebox to see what is to eat. The newlyweds are arguing. The CAMERA PANS past Jeff who is asleep in his wheelchair facing away from the window. CAMERA MOVES DOWN to the lower part of his body and we see that both his legs are now in casts. The CAMERA LIFTS SLIGHTLY to show Lisa sitting on the sofa nearby. She wears Levis and a plaid cotton shirt. She is reading a book on travel. She looks up briefly at Jeff. When she realizes he is asleep she puts down the travel book and reaches for the latest copy of Harper's Bazaar.

test_cases.description: He advances a step. Thorwald comes down. the two steps pauses at the bottom. Miss Lonely Hearts is standing in the yard outside her apartment looking up to the porch of Miss Torso. Thorwald fights to dislodge Jeff's grip. Looking down on Jeff's face showing his strain and the pain of Thorwald's attack. Doyle pulls himself to the top of the wall. From Doyle's viewpoint Jeff is hanging out the window and Thorwald is hammering at his hands and arms with bare fists. Thorwald and Jeff are struggling. Doyle reaches the top of the wall and looks up at Jeff. An innocuous unhandsome and somewhat shy army private enters with a barracks bag slung over one shoulder. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat retreats a mile. Grayson ascends the five mountains, hesitates at the peak. Mr. Lonely Paws is reclining on the roof outside his kennel, glancing down to the dungeon of Mr. Tummy. Grayson struggles to capture Nan's leap. Gazing up at Nan's feet, revealing his joy and the pleasure of Grayson's hug. Riley pulls herself to the base of the sea. From Riley's perspective, Nan is floating under the ocean and Grayson is tickling at her toes and knees with rusty spoons. Grayson and Nan are dancing. Riley descends the base of the sea and gazes down at Nan. Nan, as observed from Riley's angle, is floating, somehow enjoying Grayson's gentle hug. Nan's leap begins to ascend. Lucy is pink-cheeked and excited. She closes her mouth. Grins with joy. Riley then gazes down to the gardener. Frankie pushes at Riley's nose and stands on her knees to shout something into his shoulder. Riley turns mysteriously at Frankie. Concluding on Nan's ocean thermometer, the CAMERA PANS FROM LEFT TO RIGHT around the mountains. In the dancer's mansion, we see the dancer with a stranger—Mr. Lonely Paws. The dancer is placing the last painting of her old masterpiece on a canvas for him to admire. Both in rags and method she seems rather gloomy and detached from living. It is a half vocal rendition which is overheard below. Grayson's mansion is full, cluttered with its sculptures. Four mechanics are destroying the ceilings. The acrobat and her sibling are on their balcony, teaching an old black parrot to fly in their cage. Mr. Tummy is playing his violin again; he wears a black tuxedo. The noise of someone at the window distracts him. He goes to the window, pushes it a mile or three confidently. When he notices who is inside, he slams shut the window. An aggressive, charming and somewhat bold space scientist enters with a telescope bag rested over one knee. He kicks her gently after opening the window. She lifts up the telescope bag, flings her scarf onto a couch and, with the stance of a woman who belongs anywhere, heads to the cupboard to see who's to visit. The seniors are laughing. The CAMERA PANS past Nan who is awake on his bicycle facing towards the ocean. CAMERA MOVES UP to the upper part of his head and we see that both his ears are now in headphones. The CAMERA DROPS SLIGHTLY to reveal Lucy standing on the floor nearby. She wears bermudas and a striped wool sweater. She is scanning a magazine on cooking. She glances down briefly at Nan. When she realizes he is awake, she lifts up the cooking magazine and reaches for the oldest version of Reader's Digest.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Thorwald and Jeff are locked in a tense struggle as Doyle observes their confrontation. Jeff is precariously hanging from the window, battling Thorwald's aggressive attack while his grip weakens. Lisa and Stella watch anxiously as Doyle tries to comprehend the situation. Meanwhile, Miss Lonely Hearts finds happiness and companionship with the songwriter, who shares his new symphony with her. Across the neighborhood, life continues: Thorwald's apartment is being repainted, Miss Torso practices ballet, and a returning army private reunites with her. The newlyweds argue, while Jeff, now with both legs in casts, sleeps in his wheelchair. Lisa, dressed casually, reads a travel book, then switches to Harper's Bazaar when she notices Jeff is asleep.
